items.title: EcoFlow’s final V-Day flash sale drops DELTA 2 power station to $399 for 72 hours (Save $300), more from $549
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Valentine’s Day Sale that is only lasting through the weekend, EcoFlow has launched the last of this event’s flash sales, taking up to 62% off four offers and lasting a full 72 hours. One of the more attainable and accessible models is the DELTA 2 Portable Power Station at $399 shipped, which beats out its Amazon pricing by $30. While you may see it sporting a full $1,049 MSRP tag, you can much more often find it down around $699 on average, with recent discounts regularly keeping things at $399. This 72-hour deal is keeping the costs down among its lowest prices – only $50 above the low that we last saw during Black Friday. Head below to learn more about it and browse the other 72-hour savings.

items.title: JSAUX All-in-One Switch 2 Carrying Case is bigger and costs 65% less than Nintendo’s at $29 all-time low
items.summary:
JSAUX All-in-One large carrying case for Nintendo Switch 2

Buy for $29 (Reg. $46)

What we love

If you want something protective to carry your entire Switch 2 setup, JSAUX’s all-in-one case is a great pick. It fits the console, controllers, dock, cables, power bank, and up to 10 games, all neatly organized. You also get EVA padding, a hard water-resistant shell, and a handle plus shoulder strap for easy travel. It can be a lot better than other carrying cases if you need to carry more than just your console and a few games.

items.summary:
We just spotted a solid deal at Walmart that bundles Anker’s Prime 140W 4-port charger with a 25,000mAh 165W power bank for $104.99 shipped. That’s a ridiculously low price, considering the power bank itself is currently going for $105 on Amazon right now as part of a Valentine’s Day sale. The 140W charger typically goes for $90, so you’re essentially getting $210 worth of gear for half the price. It’s a great value if you’re looking to upgrade your setup for both home and travel charging. We don’t expect this deal to last long, so it’s worth grabbing while it’s still available.
